lexUnit.name: sleep_event.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: 1. a regularly recurring condition of body and mind in which the nervous system is inactive, the eyes closed, the postural muscles relaxed, and consciousness practically suspended.

sentence.text: In 1922 , he made The Man Without Desire , an imaginative account of a man who wakes from a sleep of several hundred years only to find he suffers from a lack of emotion .
LOUD French frogs are disturbing the sleep of English home owners .
Behind one of the windows Mrs Chester , her head swimming from the bridge game , was probably watching over the sleep of her daughter .
At 4am the secretary 's sleep was shattered .
Karen Coulthard tucks up her triplets before their afternoon sleep , safe in their own home .
Her eyes went straight to the wicker chair by the window where a baby was just waking from its morning sleep .
With some airlines , there is the facility ( for example the ` sleeperette " , to take a good sleep rather than just a nap ) .
This time it will be a long sleep , Cadfael .
And shivering , I awoke from my long sleep .
Tonight , wherever she looked she saw herself reflected and transformed , her face shining as though she had quite suddenly woken up after a long sleep , filled with lovely dreams .
Sometimes volunteers alternate between normal and long sleeps ( lasting 16 rather than 8 hours , for example ) or even appear to adopt a sleep/wake cycle that lasts about 50 rather than 25 hours .
It starts raining and they rush for the car , where they have an afternoon sleep .
Why are n't you going to have a sleep , I 'd like to have a sleep .
You can have a nice little sleep in the car .
` Christ , you even crawl in your sleep . "
They lose a night 's sleep slugging it out .
